meanings.definition: Very small or miniature in size.
meanings.sent1: The toy car was lilliput, fitting in the palm of my hand.
meanings.sent2: The lilliput flowers added a delicate touch to the garden.
meanings.sent3: The lilliput puppy tried to bark like a big dog, but it came out as a tiny squeak.
meanings.sent4: In the vast forest, the lilliput mushrooms seemed like tiny fairy homes.
meanings.sent5: The lilliput stars twinkled in the night sky, barely visible to the naked eye.

meanings.definition: A small or insignificant person or thing.
meanings.sent1: She felt like a lilliput in the presence of the famous actors.
meanings.sent2: The tiny ant was a lilliput compared to the giant beetle.
meanings.sent3: The lilliput pebble rolled down the hill, feeling important among the rocks.
meanings.sent4: In the world of technology, my old phone was a lilliput among the new models.
meanings.sent5: The lilliput snowflake melted instantly on my warm palm.
